greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: First order recursion: a(0)=1; a(n) = sigma(1,n) - a(n-1).
comment: Provide interesting decomposition: sigma(n)=u+w, where u and w consecutive terms of this sequence; this depends also on initial value.
program: (PARI) lista(nn) = {my(last = 1, v=vector(nn)); for (n=1, nn, v[n] = sigma(n) - last; last = v[n]; ); concat(1, v); } \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 28 2020
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Apr 23 2003
